feature.name: Divine Domain: Truth Domain (HB)
feature.text:
This cleric is born a truth teller. They are innately present and are wiser than most humanoids. High priests search the land for these blessed beings and help guide them along their challenging path. These clerics are destined to speak the truth and change the world.
Domain Spells: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Truth Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.
Truth Domain Spells: Cleric Level | Spells 1st | detect evil and good, sanctuary 3rd | aid, zone of truth 5th | beacon of hope, mass healing word 7th | conjure minor elemental, dimension door 9th | commune with nature, legend lore
Source: Monsters of the City: Sins & Virtues p. 136

feature.name: Truly Present (Truth Domain (HB))
feature.text:
Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.
Source: Monsters of the City: Sins & Virtues p. 136

feature.name: Channel Divinity: True Path (Truth Domain (HB))
feature.text:
As an action, the cleric can present their holy symbol and find a path that avoids any physical traps for 1 minute, and (if possible) difficult terrain.
Source: Monsters of the City: Sins & Virtues p. 136

feature.name: Perceptive Aura (Truth Domain (HB))
feature.text:
The cleric and any allies within 30 ft. have +2 to their Wisdom (Insight) checks.
Source: Monsters of the City: Sins & Virtues p. 136

feature.name: True Colors (Truth Domain (HB))
feature.text:
The truth teller has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to discern the truth.
Source: Monsters of the City: Sins & Virtues p. 136

feature.name: Divine Strike (Truth Domain (HB))
feature.text:
You gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 force damage. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.
Source: Monsters of the City: Sins & Virtues p. 136

feature.name: Truesight (Truth Domain (HB))
feature.text:
Gains truesight 90 ft.
Source: Monsters of the City: Sins & Virtues p. 136
